ratings.comment: I really enjoyed this class. Professor Coon was very accessible and always willing to help her students. You can tell she cares about teaching and is very open to feedback. She made class interesting but be prepared to do a lot of work outside of class. It was worth it in my opinion!

I thought Kerri was a good professor; I just wasn't a fan of the class curriculum itself.  Interesting topics covered, but way too much homework and peer grading for a 3-credit class.  Class did not have TAs, which made getting one-on-one help hard.  Lots of easy extra credit opportunities.  I really hated the big group project, as did everyone.

Positives: majority of your grade is completion-based and a lot of extra credit. Negatives: there are an EXCESSIVE amount of homework assignments with even more "peer reviews" with those assignments. Module assessments or "exams" do NOT align with this class being approached through global health. Group project was also a terrible experience.

One of the worst instructors at UW. She made her personal mission to harass students saying more then 50% of the class used AI to complete the work even though many people didn't, she asked us to redo the assignment for half the credit even after providing proof and continued to give random scores for assignments that are graded on completion.

Insane amount of busywork. Confusing professor, syllabus, grading. Didn't learn much. Did not enjoy. Probably one of my least favorite classes I've taken here. I don't think that she was prepared for the size of the class. I didn't enjoy it. Discussions (some lectures were designated discussion times) were mandatory attendance.

Kerri was awesome! I had her in the spring of 2022 for Microbiology 345 and she was the best professor I have ever had. I don't usually excel in school, but I got an A in her class because of how she taught and the level of engagement she got from the class.
